conclusion: Two particles, A and B, start from rest at the same position and move in the same direction. Their velocities over time are plotted in the graph.
The graph shows velocity on the y-axis and time on the x-axis. There are two lines: one for particle A and one for particle B.
Particle A's line starts from zero velocity and increases linearly to 2v₀ at time t₀, then decreases linearly back to zero at time 2t₀.
Particle B's line starts from zero velocity and increases linearly to v₀ at time 5t₀, then decreases linearly back to zero at time 6t₀.
The area under each graph gives the displacement of the particle at any time.

premise: The area under each graph gives the displacement of the particle at any time.
conclusion: To find when they meet, find a time where both particles have the same displacement from the starting point.
Denote the displacement of particle A as s_A and that of particle B as s_B. Find a time t where s_A = s_B.
The total time for particle A's cycle is 2t₀.
The total time for particle B's cycle is 6t₀.
For particle A, from t=0 to t=t₀, v_A = (2v₀ / t₀) t.
For particle A, from t=t₀ to t=2t₀, v_A = - (2v₀ / t₀) (t - t₀).

premise: Integration of v_A from 0 to t.
conclusion: For t ≤ t₀, s_A(t) = (v₀ / t₀) t².

premise: Integration of v_A from 0 to t.
conclusion: For t > t₀, s_A(t) = v₀ t₀ - (v₀ / t₀) * ( (t - t₀)² / 2 ).
At t=6t₀, the displacements of A and B are equal, and they meet.
